reviews.text: We just returned from Chicago after staying at the Hyatt Deerfield. I have really been around to nice hotels, and I must say that the Hyatt does really well for itself. We stayed there because they are Six Flags Great America's premiere hotel partner. That means that Six Flags and the Hyatt have a deal where you can get a normal room with 2 six flags tickets for only 149 dollars!! That's a great deal considering that normal six flags tickets cost 45-55 dollars.
reviews.title: Great rooms (like SUITES), GREAT RATES!!!
My Hyatt Stay Was Great!
reviews.text: The rooms were almost like suites. You enter the door, and see a 'room' (I'll explain the '--' shortly) with a couch, a desk, and a few chairs. The couch faces an entertainment center with a depth of the wall that divides the 'living room' and the 'bedroom.' Really, the room is just one big room with a small dividing wall on the back. But what the hotel does is it puts an entertainment center with a TV that can swivel to face both the living room AND the beds, so it seems like you have to spacious rooms. The feeling that creates is really home-y and nice. The bathroom included very nice toilitries (citrus and lavendar work well for me). The beds were very comfortable.
The swimming pool is small, but the health center with excersize machines was really big, and included many pieces of excersize equipment.
reviews.title: great suburban hotel

reviews.text: The morning breakfast buffet was VERY expensive for the weekday that we were there (16 dollars!!!!). While I have paid that occasionally to have those breakfast buffets, I have done that only when at the Ritz Carleton or Disney where you EXPECT those prices. The Starbucks offered some pretty crappy looking muffins. Fortunately, there was a Starbucks about a mile and a half down the road (take a left from the hotel), which had a better and CHEAPER assortment of breakfast items.
reviews.title: Nice hotel-could have been cleaner
Accomodating, stylish rooms, great stay...
reviews.text: Overall, it was a great stay because it offered GREAT prices on the rooms, and the rooms themselves were very spacious and comfortable. While not within walking distance of the six flags property, it was only a 20 minute drive, and the hotel itself was cheaper and nicer than the big chain hotels closer to the Six Flags property.

description: Full service hotel. Newly Renovated Suite sized guest rooms to include 6 Executive Suites, 1 Presidential Suite, and 1 Hospitality Suite. Amenities to include: living room area with pull out couch, iron/ironing board, hair dryer, coffee maker, referigerators in room, turn down services available, business class floor, newly renovated restaurant and meeting space. A premier suburban corporate hotel located in the heart of Chicago's Northshore. The Hyatt Deerfield is ideally located just 14 miles from O'Hare International Airport and minutes from Fortune-500 companies such as, Abbott Pharmaceuticals, Kraft Foods, Baxter Healthcare, and Morgan Stanley Discover. Enjoy an evening at Ravinia Festival, a day at Chicago's Botanic Gardens, or the excitement of Six Flags Great America, all in close proximity. The Hyatt Deerfield offers cigars at our outdoor patio, newly renovated restaurant, atrium lounge, in-room dining, and a full fitness facility including indoor pool, sauna, Jacuzzi and full line of cardiovascular equipment. Located off 294/94 express way 14 miles from O'Hare International Airport.
